sem_template.sem_long_description: Legacy authentication protocols such as IMAP, POP3, and SMTP Basic Authentication are vulnerable to password spray and brute-force attacks. Microsoft recommends disabling them to reduce the attack surface.
sem_recommendations: Disable legacy authentication in the Microsoft 365 Admin Center.
Enable modern authentication for all users.
Monitor sign-ins to verify no active use of legacy protocols.

sem_template.sem_long_description: MFA significantly reduces the risk of account compromise by requiring an additional verification factor beyond just a password.
sem_recommendations: Enable MFA for all administrative accounts.
Roll out MFA to all user accounts with a phased adoption plan.
Use app-based authenticators instead of SMS when possible.
